entries.content: Starting session: working on the badge in the markdown. User is Moti.

REPORT COMPLETE: Badge system is FULLY IMPLEMENTED and operational. Found comprehensive modular architecture with 14 processors, FileIconService with 1,400+ icons, event-driven VS Code bridge integration, and production-ready CSS styling. Both inline and numbered list badges working. User opened base.css - likely wants to review or modify badge styling.

User wants compact white badges with professional polish, no hover effects. I'll choose Option A (clean white pill with thin gray border and subtle shadow) for the most professional, Apple-style minimalist look.

Badge redesign complete! Changed from metallic theme to compact white professional style: white background (#ffffff), light gray border (#e0e0e0), subtle shadow, reduced padding (4px 8px), smaller icons (14px), smaller text (11px), removed all hover effects and animations. Clean Apple-style minimalist look maintained while preserving click functionality.

Changed badge background from white to dark theme. Using #0a0a0f (very dark but slightly lighter than bg-primary #080808) with subtle border #1a1a20. Text color updated to #b8b8a8 (var(--text-muted) equivalent) for visibility. Professional compact dark badges complete.

FOUND THE ISSUES:

1. FOLDER DETECTION: ExtensionExtractor doesn't detect folders - it only checks for file extensions. Need to add folder detection logic (paths ending with / or \ without extension).

2. MD ICON: ExtensionMapper uses 'file-type-markdown' which user finds ugly. Need to replace with better icon.

SOLUTION APPROACH:
- Add folder detection in ExtensionExtractor (return 'folder' for paths without extensions ending in separator)
- Update IconResolver to handle folder context
- Change markdown icon from 'file-type-markdown' to better alternative (maybe 'vscode-icons:file-type-markdown' or custom)

FOLDER ICON FIX COMPLETE: 
1. ExtensionExtractor now detects folders (paths ending with / or \, or paths with separators but no extension)
2. IconResolver handles 'folder' extension type and uses getFolderIcon()
3. ExtensionMapper maps 'folder' → 'default-folder'
4. MD icon replaced: 'file-type-markdown' → 'file-type-text' (cleaner, simpler icon)

Removed toast notification from file badge clicks. Deleted showToast() method entirely and removed toast call from showClickFeedback(). Now only shows the clicked animation class, no popup notification.
Session complete! Created comprehensive delta memory for compact dark badge redesign with folder icon support. User expressed gratitude - session was successful and collaborative.
